logentry.author: tortoisesvn
logentry.msg: Add methods to export and import the auth data that the svn library stores. Since the svn lib stores the auth data partially encrypted (passwords and passphrases), these methods decrypt and encrypt that data as well, and the exported data is encrypted with a specified password again. This allows to export/import that data on other computers.

logentry.author: tortoisesvn
logentry.msg: Handle url and link drop formats, allow dropping them onto the project monitor. Note: while it's now possible to drop urls from FireFox and Chrome, it's not possible to drop them from IE! That's because IE runs in protected mode which prevents dropping items onto higher level processes (which TSVN is). It's possible to enable this via a registry key for individual processes, but I'm not going to do that in the TSVN installer. See here for more info: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb250462%28v=vs.85%29.aspx (Understanding and Working in Protected Mode Internet Explorer)

logentry.author: tortoisesvn
logentry.msg:
Patch from kosuebi22: Convert the font name to utf8 if Scintilla is in D2D mode. This prevents problems with certain fonts that have non-English names. Note: the problem still persists in GDI mode since Scintilla does not use the wide version of the Windows API for those.
See http://www.trigeminal.com/samples/font_choices.html for more info about the problem with non-English font names.

logentry.msg:
Patch from Adam D. Walling: CLogDlg::FillLogMessageCtrl incorrectly styles bug ID links when multiple revisions are selected; the CRLF is treated as one character, and so any \r are removed. However this step was skipped when multiple revisions are selected, automatically generating the message.
The attached patch unconditionally performs the \r removal after the m_bSingleRevision checks.

logentry.author: tortoisesvn
logentry.msg: Merged revision(s) r25403 from trunk: * When canceling the log dialog: if there's a timeout on the first cancel try just return. Only if the timeout persists on the second try exit the process. Reason: setting the cancel flag and waiting for the threads to exit might never happen since at least the log thread accesses the UI and therefore needs the UI thread to handle the message loop. But when waiting for the threads to exit, the message loop isn't handled so there's a deadlock situation.

logentry.author: tortoisesvn
logentry.msg: When canceling the log dialog: if there's a timeout on the first cancel try just return. Only if the timeout persists on the second try exit the process. Reason: setting the cancel flag and waiting for the threads to exit might never happen since at least the log thread accesses the UI and therefore needs the UI thread to handle the message loop. But when waiting for the threads to exit, the message loop isn't handled so there's a deadlock situation.
